Bounding Hounds.name: Phantomhunde
Bounding Hounds.description: Drei Phantomhunde jagen Eindringlinge und fügen jedem Schaden zu, durch den sie sich hindurchbewegen.
Bounding Hounds.disable: @Check[nature|dc:36]{Naturkunde} (Experte), um jeweils einen Hund zu besänftigen, oder @Check[occultism|dc:38]{Okkultismus} (Meister), um jeweils einen Hund zu verbannen
Bounding Hounds.routine: (9 Aktionen) Die Falle verliert pro ausgeschaltetem Hund 3 Aktionen. Jeder Hund nutzt 3 Aktionen jeweils zum Laufen (Bewegungsrate 40 Fuß/12 m), um körperlichen Kreaturen im Raum nachzustellen und während dieser Bewegung durch sie hindurchzulaufen. Jede Kreatur, durch die sich ein Hund während seiner Bewegung hindurchbewegt, erleidet @Damage[(2d8 + 7)[void]]{2W8+7 Punkte Leerenschaden} (@Check[reflex|dc:37|traits:damaging-effect]{Reflexwurf}, keine Wirkung). Eine Kreatur kann durch jeden Hund pro Runde nur einmal Schaden erleiden, egal wie oft ein Hund ihre Fläche durchquert.

action->Bay.name: Bellen
action->Bay.description:
Auslöser Eine Kreatur betritt den Wirkungsbereich

Effekt Die Hunde manifestieren sich und bellen laut; dies fügt allen Kreaturen innerhalb von @Template{emanation|distance:30]{30 Fuß/9 m} Entfernung zu den Hunden @Damage[(3d10 + 16)[sonic]]{3W10+16 Punkte Schallschaden} zu (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic]{einfacher Zähigkeitswurf}). Bei einem misslungenen Rettungswurf erhält die Kreatur zudem den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Verängstigt 2}. Die Falle würfelt dann ihre Initiative aus.

Call of the Void.name: Ruf der Leere
Call of the Void.description: Ein übernatürlicher Drang, ins Unbekannte zu springen, befällt jeden, der sich der Kante nähert.
Call of the Void.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:34]{Okkultismus}, oder @Check[arcana|dc:36]{Arkane Künste}, um den magischen Zwang von der aktuellen Insel und den direkt mit ihr verbundenen roten Seilen zu bannen; die betroffenen Seile verdunkeln sich daraufhin. Das Echo schaltet zudem automatisch die Gefahr bei jeder Insel aus, auf der er steht, sowie der mit ihr direkt verbundenen roten Seile, wenn er auf dieser Insel Aus Gedanken wiedererstehen nutzt.
Call of the Void.reset: Der Ruf der Leere währt, solange das Echo existiert, aktiviert sich aber erst, wenn das Echo seine Initiative gewürfelt hat. Die Gefahr setzt sich jeden Tag zurück.
Call of the Void.routine: (1 Aktion) Der Ruf hat alle Kreaturen zum Ziel, die sich zur einer Kante angrenzend oder auf einem der roten Seile befinden, und zieht an ihrem Verstand. Eine Kreatur, die in dieser Runde bereits gestürzt ist, ist immun.
Call of the Void.stealth: (Experte), um ein schwaches Ziehen zu bemerken

action->Leap into the Unknown.name: Sprung ins Unbekannte
action->Leap into the Unknown.description:
Auslöser Eine Kreatur betritt ein zum Rand einer Insel angrenzendes Feld oder tritt auf eines der roten Seile

Effekt Der Ruf der Leere zieht am Verstand von Eindringlingen und drängt sie, über die Kante zu springen. Eine betroffene Kreatur muss einen @Check[will|dc:34]{Willenswurf} oder einen Wurf für @Check[acrobatics|dc:32|traits:action:balance]{Akrobatik} zum @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.M76ycLAqHoAgbcej]{Balancieren} ablegen; bei Misslingen stürzt sie über die Kante. Sollte die Kreatur herabstürzen, fällt sie 100 Fuß/30 m, ehe die räumliche Schleife sie wieder auf das Ursprungsfeld zurückbringt und sie den üblichen Sturzschaden erleidet (meistens @Damage[50[bludgeoning]]{50 Punkte Wuchtschaden}). Der Ruf der Leere würfelt dann seine Initiative.

Clone Mirrors.name: Klonspiegel
Clone Mirrors.description: Zwei gegenüberliegende Spiegel generieren illusionäre Duplikate der Kreaturen im Gang in einer endlosen Flut.
Clone Mirrors.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28]{Diebeskunst} (Experte), zum Neupositionieren jedes Spiegels, oder @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Magie bannen} (3. Grad; @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.mmfWcV3Iyql5nzTo]{Entgegenwirken}-SG 25), um jedem Spiegel entgegenzuwirken
Clone Mirrors.routine: (2 Aktionen) Diese Falle verliert 1 Aktion pro ausgeschaltetem Spiegel. Jeder Spiegel nutzt 1 Aktion, um eine Reflektion einer von ihm gespiegelten Kreatur hervorzubringen. Die Gefahr kann maximal vier Reflektionen zugleich unterhalten.

action->Spawn Reflection.name: Spiegelbrut
action->Spawn Reflection.description:
Auslöser Eine Kreatur spiegelt sich im Spiegel

Effekt Der Spiegel erzeugt eine @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-dark-archive.Actor.ICdVjs6JEs0YAefl]{Reflektion} der auslösenden Kreatur, die mit einem Schritt aus dem Spiegel und in den Gang tritt. Die Falle würfelt dann ihre Initiative.

spell->Feeblemind.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD]
Feeblemind

spell->Mage Hand.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]
Mage Hand

action->Anchored in Silk.name: Anchored in Silk
action->Anchored in Silk.description: The cocoon is incapable of movement beyond slight wriggling in place. It has no Speed and can't move or be moved, even through means such as teleportation, as the Weaver's threads tether it in place physically and astrally. The cocoon casts any spells psychically, substituting verbal and somatic components for expressions of pure unbridled will and removing the manipulate trait from its Cast a Spell action.

action->Give of Oneself.name: Give of Oneself
action->Give of Oneself.description:
Trigger The Weaver would be reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The cocoon's vitality is linked to the Weaver's. It loses [[/r 30]] Hit Points, restoring [[/r 15[healing]]]{15 Hit Points} to the Weaver. It can use this ability even if it would otherwise be unable to act.

action->In There Somewhere.name: In There Somewhere
action->In There Somewhere.description: Killia's individuality still rests within the cocoon, yet trying to resist assimilation. If a PC succeeds at a @Check[diplomacy|dc:32] check on the cocoon, the cocoon takes @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as Killia's consciousness fights the Weaver. The cocoon can't be affected in this way more than once per turn.

action->Of Same Essence.name: Of Same Essence
action->Of Same Essence.description: The cocoon and the Weaver share the same essence. Its spells never affect the Weaver if they would harm him, and the Weaver can ignore the any of the cocoon's active spell effects if he desires (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.tSosbMsftXcRaQgT]{Sea of Thought}).

Confounding Portal.name: Verwirrender Durchgang
Confounding Portal.description: Winzige, um eine Türzarge oder in die Wände eines Ganges eingeritzte Runen verwirren Kreaturen, so dass sie im Kreis gehen.
Confounding Portal.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:17]{Diebeskunst}, um die Runen auszukratzen, oder @Check[arcana|dc:16]{Arkane Künste}, um die Runen zu zerstören.

action->Confounding Misdirection.name: Verwirrende Irreführung
action->Confounding Misdirection.description:
Auslöser Eine Kreatur durchquert den mit Runen versehenen Durchgang oder Gang

Effekt Die Kreatur wird von den Illusionen @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Verwirrt}, so dass sie in den Raum zurückkehrt, den sie eigentlich durch die Tür verlassen wollte, bzw. ans andere Ende des Ganges zurückgeht. Für die auslösende Kreatur scheint es keinen Unterschied zu geben, sie glaubt, die Tür zu durchschreiten, bzw. den Gang hinunterzugehen, und für Beobachter wirkt es genauso. Eine Kreatur kann dieser Illusion mit einem @Check[will|dc:19]{Willenswurf} widerstehen und den Raum verlassen oder den Gang hinabgehen, ohne in die Irre geführt zu werden.

Constricting Hall.name: Schlagende Wände
Constricting Hall.description: Alle vier Wände des Ganges werden elastisch und dehnbar, wenn sich eine Kreatur in der Mitte des Ganges befindet.
Constricting Hall.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28]{Diebeskunst} (Geübt), um jede Wand zu stabilisieren, oder UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Magie bannen} (4. Grad; @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.mmfWcV3Iyql5nzTo]{Entgegenwirken}-SG 26), um jeder Wand entgegenzuwirken
Constricting Hall.routine: (4 Aktionen) Diese Falle verliert 1 Aktion jede Runde pro Wand, die ausgeschaltet wurde. Jede Wand nutzt 1 Aktion, um auf eine Kreatur im Gang mit einem Wandangriff einzuprügeln. Bei einem Treffer erhält das Ziel zudem den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Liegend}. Die Wände verteilen ihre Angriff möglichst gleichmäßig auf die Kreaturen im Gang. Die Wandangriffe unterliegen mit dem Malus für Mehrfachangriffe der Falle.

action->Lose Form.name: Form verlieren
action->Lose Form.description:
Auslöser Eine Kreatur erreicht die Mitte des Ganges

Effekt Die Wände des Ganges verlieren ihre Starrheit und werden elastisch und nachgiebig. Der Gang wird zu Schwierigem Gelände und jede Kreatur muss einen @Check[reflex|dc:26]{Reflexwurf} ablegen; bei Misslingen erhält sie den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Liegend}. Die Falle würfelt dann ihre Initiative.

Disorienting Illusions.name: Desorientierende Illusionen
Disorienting Illusions.description: Illusionen verhüllen diese Kammer und lassen sie verzerrt und in ständiger Bewegung erscheinen – alles wirkt schief, unregelmäßig und in Bewegung.
Disorienting Illusions.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:17]{Handwerkskunst} (Geübt), um die Dimensionen des Raumes trotz der Illusionen zu berechnen, oder @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Magie bannen} (1. Grad; @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.mmfWcV3Iyql5nzTo]{Entgegenwirken}-SG 17), um den Illusionen entgegenzuwirken.

action->Disorient.name: Desorientieren
action->Disorient.description:
Auslöser Eine Kreatur betritt den Raum

Effekt Illusionen lassen den Raum und Gegenstände darin 1 Minute lang ständig in Bewegung erscheinen, wobei sie sich verzerren und verschieben. Jede Kreatur im Raum muss während der Wirkungsdauer einen @Check[perception|dc:17]{Wahrnehmungswurf} ablegen:

Kritischer Erfolg Die Kreatur zweifelt die Illusionen erfolgreich an und ist nicht betroffen.

Erfolg Die Kreatur zweifelt die Illusionen zwar an, sieht sie aber immer noch. Sie behandelt den Raum als Schwieriges Gelände.

Fehlschlag Die Kreatur wird von den Illusionen genarrt. Sie behandelt den Raum als Schwieriges Gelände und erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Kränkelnd 1}. Solange sie im Raum verweilt, kann sie den Zustandswert für Kränkelnd nicht unter 1 reduzieren.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Wie beim Fehlschlag, aber wenn die Kreatur eine Handlung der Kategorie Bewegung versucht, muss sie einen @Check[flat|dc:5]{Einfachen Wurf} ablegen; bei Misslingen verliert sie die Handlung (bei einem Kritischen Fehlschlag erhält sie zudem den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Liegend}).

Distortion Mirror.name: Zerrspiegel
Distortion Mirror.description: Spiegelkabinette nutzen Spiegel, um die Darstellung des Betrachters zu verzerren und dabei den Körper auf schmerzvolle Weise umzuformen, damit er dem Spiegelbild entspricht.
Distortion Mirror.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:38]{Diebeskunst} (Meister), um die Spiegelfläche zu beschmieren, oder @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Magie bannen} (7. Grad; @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.mmfWcV3Iyql5nzTo]{Entgegenwirken}-SG 36), um den Spiegel zu bannen oder der Verwandlung entgegenzuwirken

action->Painful Transformation.name: Schmerzhafte Verwandlung
action->Painful Transformation.description:
Auslöser Ein Kreatur wird im Spiegel gespiegelt

Effekt Der Körper der auslösenden Kreatur wird schmerzhaft gestaucht, gestreckt und verdreht, um dem Spiegelbild zu entsprechen. Die Kreatur erleidet @Damage[(6d10 + 30)[force]]{6W10+30 Punkte Kraftschaden} und muss einen @Check[fortitude|dc:39|traits:damaging-effect]{Zähigkeitswurf} ablegen:

Kritischer Erfolg Das Ziel ist nicht betroffen.

Erfolg Das Ziel erleidet halben Schaden und für 1 Runde die Zustände @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 1} und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 1}.

Fehlschlag Das Ziel erleidet vollen Schaden und für 4 Runden die Zustände @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Kraftlos 2} und @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Unbeholfen 2}.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Das Ziel erleidet doppelten Schaden und für 1 Minute die Zustände Kraftlos 2 und Unbeholfen 2. Solange einer dieser Zustände anhält, erleidet es zudem einen Zustandsmalus von -10 Fuß/3 m auf seine Bewegungsraten.

Enden die Effekte dieser Falle, endet die Verwandlung der auslösenden Kreatur und sie nimmt wieder ihre natürliche Gestalt an.

Entrapping Chair.name: Entrapping Chair
Entrapping Chair.description: A chair on concealed tracks surges forward, knocking a creature into the chair's seat and trapping them in place with clamping armrests.
Entrapping Chair.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:23|name:Disrupt the Tracks|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to disrupt the tracks
Entrapping Chair.reset: The trap resets automatically over 2 rounds if the chair is unoccupied.

action->Take a Seat!.name: Take a Seat!
action->Take a Seat!.description:
Trigger A creature steps on the track

Effect The chair rockets forward along the track and slams into the triggering creature, dealing @Damage[(3d8 + 15)[bludgeoning]] damage. A creature who succeeds at a @Check[reflex|dc:22|traits:damaging-effect] save takes no damage and moves out of the chair's path into a random adjacent square not containing the track. A creature who fails this saving throw is knocked into the chair's seat and immediately captured by the armrests, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} on a critical failure; Escape DC 26).

Exhaling Portal.name: Exhaling Portal
Exhaling Portal.description: Magic runes carved into a doorframe connect a door to the Plane of Air when opened, blowing creatures down the connecting hall.
Exhaling Portal.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:30|name:Scratch Out Runes|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) twice to scratch out the runes, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th level; counteract DC 30) to counteract the planar runes; @Check[athletics|dc:32|name:Shut the Door] to shut the door if it's open (using Athletics only stops the trap, it doesn't fully disable it)
Exhaling Portal.routine: (1 action) The trap uses 1 action to blow powerful winds down the hall. Each creature in the hall must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save with the same results as Gust. If this forced movement would cause a creature to collide with a solid object or fall downstairs or out a window, that creature takes an additional @Damage[(2d10 + 11)[bludgeoning]] damage (or @Damage[20[bludgeoning]] damage due to a fall).

action->Gust.name: Gust
action->Gust.description:
Trigger A creature opens the door

Effect The hall is buffeted by powerful winds for as long as the door remains open. A creature must succeed at a @Check[athletics|dc:32] check to move toward the door. A creature who fails at this check is pushed back 5 feet and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Additionally, the triggering creature is blasted by a powerful gust of wind and must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:32] save. The trap then rolls initiative.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is pushed back 5 feet.

Failure The creature is pushed back 10 feet.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed back 10 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

False Floor.name: False Floor
False Floor.description: The floor in this chamber is an illusion, which conceals a 40-foot drop to the true floor below. Additionally, the area beneath the floor is magically silenced-no sound is audible within nor does sound leave this space.
False Floor.disable: Succeeding on a Perception check against the Stealth DC of 21 (including the check to find the trap) disbelieves the illusory floor, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd level; counteract DC 18) to dispel the illusory floor; dispel magic (2nd level; counteract DC 20) to dispel the magical silence
False Floor.stealth: (trained; or 0 if the illusory floor is dispelled)

action->Drop.name: Drop
action->Drop.description:
Trigger A creature walks onto the illusory floor

Effect The triggering creature falls through the illusory floor and takes falling damage (typically @Damage[20[bludgeoning]] damage). That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} reaction to avoid falling. The DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb} the walls (@Check[athletics|dc:20|traits:action:climb]) or Grab an Edge is @Check[reflex|dc:20|traits:action:grab-an-edge].

False Step Floor.name: False Step Floor
False Step Floor.description: Each time a creature enters the room, it slips through the floor, tumbles through an interdimensional void, and falls back into the room through the ceiling, landing on the floor.
False Step Floor.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Disrupt the Magical Energy|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disrupt the magical energy, or @Check[arcana|dc:27|name:Realign the Magic] or @Check[occultism|dc:27|name:Realign the Magic] (trained) to realign the magical energy

action->False Step.name: False Step
action->False Step.description:
Trigger A creature enters the room and steps onto the floor

Effect The creature slips through the floor; it tumbles through an interdimensional void before falling back into the room through the ceiling and landing on the floor. The triggering creature takes @Damage[40[bludgeoning]] damage from the fall. That creature can try to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} (DC 24) to avoid falling.

action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]
Attack of Opportunity (Special)
action->Attack of Opportunity (Special).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]

The Echo has reach 15 for the purpose of determining when Attack of Opportunity triggers and when making Attacks of Opportunity.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.AttackOfOpportunity]

action->Destabilized Form.name: Destabilized Form
action->Destabilized Form.description:
When the Echo has fewer than 140 Hit Points, his form destabilizes, large chunks disintegrating from his face, limbs, and torso. White moths constantly stream from the missing spaces, creating a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that deals @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage with a @Check[will|dc:34|basic].

As long as the aura persists, he can dissolve into moths and re-form at another location within 15 feet as a free action at the beginning of each of his turns; this has the occult, conjuration, and teleportation traits.

action->Astral Spindel Implement.name: Astral Spindel Implement
action->Astral Spindel Implement.description: The Echo carries a drop spindle that constantly spins red astral thread, which is both his thaumaturgic implement and weapon. If his rope dart is lost or broken, he can re-form it with an Interact action. If he critically succeeds at a rope dart Strike, overwhelming thoughts and figments flow down the thread into the target's mind. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

0.text: If he critically succeeds at a rope dart Strike, overwhelming thoughts and figments flow down the thread into the target's mind. The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

action->Astral Thread Control.name: Astral Thread Control
action->Astral Thread Control.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements The Echo's previous action was a successful thrown rope dart Strike

Effect The Echo flicks his wrist and makes a follow-up thrown rope dart Strike at a different target within 30 feet of the first target, using the same multiple attack penalty as his previous Strike. Regardless of whether his attack hits, he then retrieves the weapon.

action->Contingency Oathday-Nine-Rova.name: Contingency Oathday-Nine-Rova
action->Contingency Oathday-Nine-Rova.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger The Echo's turn begins and he's stunned, slowed, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, or otherwise can't act

Effect The Echo has set up numerous contingencies in the event he's compromised. Talismans on his body shatter, counteracting the triggering effect. The Echo can use this free action even if he can't act.

action->Reconstitute from Thought.name: Reconstitute from Thought
action->Reconstitute from Thought.description:
Requirements The Echo is standing on one of the eight large islands of the map, and the island hasn't darkened

Effect The Echo throws his rope dart into the island and uses it to absorb mental essence from the mindscape, repairing himself. He regains @Damage[45[healing]] Hit Points and the island turns a desaturated gray for 1 day, preventing future absorption and disabling the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-dark-archive.Actor.0AdtolhMWrPlzVZY]{Call of the Void} hazard on that island.

action->Spindle's Web.name: Spindle's Web
action->Spindle's Web.description:
The Echo's spindle revolves faster and faster until it's a blur, lashing red threads in every direction. The threads deal @Damage[7d6[slashing],7d6[mental]]{7d6 slashing damage and 7d6 mental damage} to all creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:30], with a @Check[reflex|dc:34|basic]. If a creature fails its save, the threads awaken the mindscape an

chor within it, affecting it differently based on which anchor that creature used to gain access to the center of the mindscape. (If there is a PC who didn't absorb a mindscape anchor, for instance because there are more than four PCs in the party, then use the anchor of the PC closest to them.)

The Echo then can't use Spindle's Web for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

  • Lantern The lantern outlines the creature with searing @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire} that deals @Damage[2d6[persistent,fire]] damage.
  • Mirror The mirror reflects the creature to another location, teleporting them to a clear space within 25 feet of their current location.
  • Chalice The chalice drains life force, granting the Echo temporary HP equal to half the damage dealt.
  • Tome The tome floods the creature's mind with information; the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Mirror Door.name: Mirror Door
Mirror Door.description: The reflection of a wall shows a phantom door where none exists. This door can only be manipulated while viewed through the mirror's reflection.
Mirror Door.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Open the Door|traits:action:disable-a-device] to open the door while viewing the reflection

action->Appear.name: Appear
action->Appear.description:
Trigger A creature views the wall through a mirror's reflection

Effect A door appears in the mirror's reflection of the wall. The triggering creature can open and manipulate this door only as long as they view it through the mirror and only by succeeding at a @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Disable the Trap|traits:action:disable-a-device] check to disable the trap.

spell->Freedom of Movement.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]
Freedom of Movement

action->Crystal Vitality Link.name: Crystal Vitality Link
action->Crystal Vitality Link.description: The power of the island links Mitera's vitality to her followers. As long as any of the three quartz formations are intact, whenever Mitera takes damage, any of her followers within 10 miles lose the same amount of Hit Points.

action->Ascension is Near.name: Ascension is Near
action->Ascension is Near.description:
Frequency once per ascension ritual

Effect Mitera activates the moonflower link with her followers. Any followers within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} who failed their saving throw against the moonflower tea become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}. Anyone who critically failed and did not receive an antidote explodes (this is about half of Mitera's congregation if the PCs didn't successfully administer the antidote). If anyone's body explodes, Mitera gains 30 temporary Hit Points and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 3 rounds; she can use this additional action each round only for Strike and Stride actions.

Quartz-Spawned Shadow.name: Quartz-Spawned Shadow
Quartz-Spawned Shadow.publicNotes: The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light. Those who parley with shadows, typically by keeping them at bay with a glowing weapon, may learn great secrets, for they are ideal spies.

action->Light Vulnerability.name: Light Vulnerability
action->Light Vulnerability.description: An object shedding magical light (such as from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WBmvzNDfpwka3qT4]{Light} spell) is treated as magical when used to attack the shadow.

action->Crystal Siphon.name: Crystal Siphon
action->Crystal Siphon.description:
Requirements The shadow and the target are both within 40 feet of the crystal that spawned the shadow, and the crystal isn't covered or obstructed

Effect Shadows in the shape of tendrils curl around the target, drawing out a portion of the target's vitality and siphoning it into the crystal. The target takes @Damage[4d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:21|basic]). On a failure, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}. This enfeebled condition is cumulative with other enfeebled conditions from quartz-spawned shadows, to a maximum of enfeebled 4. If Crystal Siphon increases the creature's enfeebled value to 3 or more, the target's shadow is pulled entirely into the shadow's crystal.

While the target's shadow is trapped, they feel an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} tether linking them to the crystal, and they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} whenever they are more than 40 feet away from it. The enfeebled condition from Crystal Siphon can't be reduced until the crystal is broken; if the crystal is broken, the effect immediately ends.

action->Slink in Shadows.name: Slink in Shadows
action->Slink in Shadows.description: The shadow can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

Reflected Desires.name: Reflected Desires
Reflected Desires.description: This mirror reflects the viewer's deepest desires.
Reflected Desires.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Shroud the Mirror|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to shroud the mirror without looking at it, or @Check[occultism|dc:17|name:Erect Mental Barriers] (trained) to erect mental barriers

action->Tempt.name: Tempt
action->Tempt.description:
Trigger A creature looks into the mirror

Effect The triggering creature sees themselves enjoying their deepest desires in the mirror's reflection, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} (@Check[will|dc:20] negates). This fascination ends automatically when the mirror is broken or covered up.

action->Reflection Routine.name: Reflection Routine
action->Reflection Routine.description: Each reflection has 2 actions which it uses to Step, Stride, or Strike (in any combination). Reflections can act on the same turn they're created.

Shrinking Hall.name: Shrinking Hall
Shrinking Hall.description: This hallway is designed to shrink as creatures traverse it, making access to the door at the hall's end impossible.
Shrinking Hall.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:21|name:Jam the Scales|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to jam the scales built into the floor
Shrinking Hall.reset: After 10 minutes without weight being placed on this hall's floor, this trap resets, returning the hall to its original size.

action->Shrink.name: Shrink
action->Shrink.description:
Trigger 100 pounds of weight or more is placed on the hallway's floor

Effect The hall's last 40 feet of walls angle inward, causing the hall to shrink and contract down, reaching 6 inches in height and width at the hall's far end and completely blocking access to the hall's exit door for anything but a Tiny creature Squeezing.

Shrouded Assailant.name: Shrouded Assailant
Shrouded Assailant.description: A spirit steps out of a covered mirror, pulling off and becoming shrouded in the cloth, which reveals the mirror. The shrouded figure attacks the living until the cloth is yanked off, which banishes the formless spirit.
Shrouded Assailant.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43|name:Steal the Cloth|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to steal the cloth before the spirit manifests, or @Check[athletics|dc:47|name:Pull the Cloth Off] to pull the cloth off the spirit after it manifests
Shrouded Assailant.reset: The haunt can be reset if the mirror is covered in a cloth or shroud.
Shrouded Assailant.routine: (3 actions) The spirit uses 3 actions to Step, fly 60 feet, or Strike, in any order. On a successful Strike the spirit's target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and on a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

action->Don Shroud.name: Don Shroud
action->Don Shroud.description:
Trigger A creature enters the area

Effect The spirit steps out of the mirror, wearing the cloth as a shroud and revealing the mirror. The triggering creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} unless they succeed at a @Check[will|dc:38] save. The haunt then rolls initiative.

Shuffling Hall.name: Shuffling Hall
Shuffling Hall.description: Four pressure plates along this mirrored hall rotate vertically when stepped on, sending a creature on the pressure plate tipping into an adjacent featureless room while simultaneously replacing the pressure plate and walls in the hall. Each pressure plate dumps creatures into a different room.
Shuffling Hall.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:12|name:Deactivate a Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] to deactivate one pressure plate

action->Flip.name: Flip
action->Flip.description:
Trigger A creature steps on a pressure plate

Effect The floor and adjoining wall rotate up and over on a central axle, tipping the triggering creature into an adjacent featureless room and simultaneously replacing the pressure plate and wall with another set on the same axle. The triggering creature is pushed into an adjoining room, takes @Damage[1d8[bludgeoning]] damage, and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. A creature who succeeds at a @Check[reflex|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save takes no damage and rolls out of the way of the trap, returning to the space they were in before stepping on the pressure plate.

Sigil of Deepest Fears.name: Sigil of Deepest Fears
Sigil of Deepest Fears.description: An arcane sigil forces creatures to confront their greatest fear.
Sigil of Deepest Fears.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:43|name:Drain the Sigil's Power|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to drain the sigil's power harmlessly, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 42) to counteract the sigil

action->Face Your Fear.name: Face Your Fear
action->Face Your Fear.description:
Trigger A creature moves within 10 feet of the sigil

Effect All creatures within 120 feet of the sigil are affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qDjeG6dxT4aEEC6J]{Weird} spell (@Check[will|dc:40|traits:damaging-effect] save).

Spirit Window.name: Spirit Window
Spirit Window.description: Spirits trapped inside a haunted window harm those who touch the window.
Spirit Window.disable: @Check[occultism|dc:48|name:Free the Spirits] (legendary) to free the spirits from the mirror, or @Check[religion|dc:48|name:Banish the Spirits] (legendary) to banish the spirits

action->Siphon Soul.name: Siphon Soul
action->Siphon Soul.description:
Trigger A creature touches the window

Effect The triggering creature takes @Damage[(8d10 + 44)[void]] damage (@Check[will|dc:42|basic]) as the window attempts to steal their soul. If this damage would kill the target, its soul is trapped inside the window with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GYmXvS9NJ7QwfWGg]{Seize Soul}.

Thalassophobic Pool.name: Thalassophobic Pool
Thalassophobic Pool.description: The pool sucks in creatures that fall into it, making them sink into its endless depths.
Thalassophobic Pool.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:32|name:Calm the Pool] (master) or @Check[deception|dc:32|name:Calm the Pool] (master) to quell the fear and calm the pool or @Check[intimidation|dc:35|name:Scare the Pool] to give the pool something worse to fear; three successes required.
Thalassophobic Pool.reset: The trap resets once there are no moving creatures in it.
Thalassophobic Pool.routine: (3 actions) Water from the chalice increases the depth of the water by 10 feet for each action. Each time this happens, creatures in the pool are pushed 10 feet down and take @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage. As the pool has no bottom, creatures in it can fall down indefinitely; they must @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx]{Swim} up to avoid drowning, but the water is especially choppy, so the Athletics DC is @Check[athletics|dc:25|traits:action:swim]. The pool never overflows. Each successful check to Disable reduces the pool's actions by 1, and once the pool is completely Disabled, the water becomes still and the Athletics DC to Swim becomes @Check[athletics|dc:10|traits:action:swim].

action->Downpour.name: Downpour
action->Downpour.description:
Trigger A creature falls into the pool

Effect More water pours forth from the chalice. Creatures in the pool become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and they can't decrease their clumsy condition so long as they remain in the pool. The trap then rolls initiative.

action->Disgusted by Food.name: Disgusted by Food
action->Disgusted by Food.description: The morrowkin eats dreams and potential, not food. A creature that spends an action to brandish food at the morrowkin automatically makes the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or increases its sickened value by 1, to a maximum of sickened 6), decreasing the morrowkin's AC, attack rolls, saves, skills, and ability DCs accordingly, as normal for the sickened condition. The morrowkin can't retch to reduce its sickened condition.

action->Endless.name: Endless
action->Endless.description: If reduced to 0 Hit Points or incapacitated for more than a few rounds, the morrowkin vanishes. In 1 minute, it reappears refreshed completely as if the previous battle never happened, with full HP, with all effects on it cleared, and with its Swallow Future ability ready to use again.

action->Drain Potential.name: Drain Potential
action->Drain Potential.description: The morrowkin tries to drain the motivation from its target, who must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:31] save. If the target fails, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2} on a critical failure) and must roll twice and use the worse result on all checks for 1 minute. Creatures wearing a hope talisman are unaffected.

action->Swallow Future.name: Swallow Future
action->Swallow Future.description:
The morrowkin inhales and draws forth the future deeds of all creatures around it. All creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:30] of the morrowkin take [[/r (6d8 + 18)[mental]]] damage and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:39] save.

The morrowkin can't Swallow Future again for 1 minute.

Creatures wearing hope talismans can choose to let their hope talisman break in order to ignore the effect after seeing the result of their Will save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 4} (likely causing it to die immediately).

action->Tomorrow's Fury.name: Tomorrow's Fury
action->Tomorrow's Fury.description: The morrowkin makes claw attacks against any number of targets within reach. The claw attacks count against the morrowkin's multiple attack penalty, but don't apply the penalty until after all attacks have been made.

action->Dreams Unraveling.name: Dreams Unraveling
action->Dreams Unraveling.description: When the Weaver has fewer than 155 Hit Points, his form partially unravels, revealing patches of pure horror acute enough to leave physical wounds. This creates a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that deals @Damage[3d6[mental],3d6[slashing]]{3d6 mental damage and 3d6 slashing damage}, with a @Check[will|dc:36|basic]. A creature Averting its Gaze is immune to the aura.

action->Nameless Nightmare.name: Nameless Nightmare
action->Nameless Nightmare.description: The Weaver has torn off his own name to become a being of fear. He is immune to linguistic effects and any effect that would impose the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition. Without a name, he is difficult for phenomena to affect; the Weaver recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} conditions at the end of his turn, and his flat check to clear persistent damage is @Check[flat|dc:5]{5}. If anyone utters, writes, or otherwise attempts to record his name, that creature automatically takes @Damage[10[mental]] damage and the attempt fails.

action->Stitch Into the Web.name: Stitch Into the Web
action->Stitch Into the Web.description:
Trigger The Weaver is moved against his will, or a creature attempts to leave a square within 20 feet of him by any means, including teleportation

Effect The Weaver's silk stitches a body in place to prevent movement. The creature stops moving and the action is disrupted. The disruption doesn't affect astral bodies.

action->Separate Astral Body.name: Separate Astral Body
action->Separate Astral Body.description: The Weaver buries a silk thread in the target's psyche and tugs, wrenching the target's astral form out of their body. Unless the target succeeds at a @Check[will|dc:36] save, their astral form is pulled out, causing a ghostly image of them to appear in an adjacent space of the Weaver's choosing. An astral body is immune to physical damage but affected normally by mental effects, force effects, and effects that directly target the spirit. The target remains connected to their physical body by a silver cord, which is always visible and possibly foils attempts to Hide. Separation from one's astral body takes a toll on the psyche, imposing a -1 status penalty to Will saves and dealing @Damage[1d6[persistent,mental]] damage for as long as the body is separated; this increases to 3d6 if the target is ever more than 30 feet from its astral body. The target can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to move their astral body an amount equal to their Speed. When the target stops taking persistent mental damage from this ability, the astral body snaps back to the physical body, ending the effect. If a target is carrying silver, then the first time this ability is used on them, the ability fails and any silver they're carrying larger than a coin tarnishes-while this doesn't outright destroy items like weapons or thaumaturge implements, it does prevent them from protecting against this ability more than once.

action->Sever Astral Threads.name: Sever Astral Threads
action->Sever Astral Threads.description: The Weaver uses a claw to cut the silver cord connecting a creature's astral and physical bodies. This deals @Damage[16d6[mental]] damage to any target affected by Separate Astral Body whose physical or astral body is within 10 feet of the Weaver (@Check[will|dc:37|basic]). After being targeted by this ability, the astral body slams violently back into the target's physical body, causing the target's vision to swim and blinding them until the start of their next turn unless they critically succeeded at their saving throw.

action->Stalker in Dreams.name: Stalker in Dreams
action->Stalker in Dreams.description:
Trigger The Weaver becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to all creatures within 60 feet or is not observed by any creatures within 60 feet

Effect The Weaver's presence on the Material Plane is connected to others' perception of him, and when that perception falters, he can skitter to a new location. The Weaver teleports to an unoccupied space within 60 feet not within line of sight of any creatures within 60 feet. If the Weaver became concealed or unobserved as part of a movement action he was taking, he can resume its movement after teleporting. A creature who Averts its Gaze from the Weaver is not observing him.

action->String Astral Body.name: String Astral Body
action->String Astral Body.description: The Weaver attaches strings to a creature's astral body to move it. He forcefully moves an exposed astral body within reach of his astral silk Strike up to 20 feet, with no saving throw.

Verdure's Moonflower.name: Verdure's Moonflower
Verdure's Moonflower.publicNotes:
These enormous plants have thick, knotted trunks festooned with fanged blossoms. A gaping mouth sits at the top of the trunk, capable of swallowing most creatures smaller than the moonflower whole. Moonflowers can move slowly on their powerful roots or use them to attack, but usually they dig them deeply into the surrounding ground and remain stationary to await prey.

Though moonflowers can't speak in the conventional sense, they communicate telepathically with other moonflowers. Explorers who encounter a single moonflower can thus be assured that any other moonflowers in the vicinity will be prepared for them. Those who manage to intercept a moonflower's telepathic communications are assaulted by visions of dreadful, primeval jungles ruled over by titanic plant life. Whether this is some vision of the past or a dream of the future shared by all moonflowers is unknown.

Moonflowers are alien life-forms from a long-dead planet, but their proliferation throughout the galaxy has been ensured through the machinations of the Dominion of the Black, a sinister, alien organization from the dark places between the stars.

action->Fast Healing 10.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]
Fast Healing 10

action->Pod Prison.name: Pod Prison
action->Pod Prison.description:
Trigger The moonflower has swallowed a creature

Effect The swallowed creature is wrapped in a tight cocoon and extruded from the moonflower's body into an adjacent square. The creature continues to be Swallowed Whole. It can't use Acrobatics to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} a pod, but other creatures can attempt to Rupture the pod. The cocooned creature takes half damage from any damage dealt to the cocoon. Once the cocoon is Ruptured, it deflates and decays.

action->Pod Spawn.name: Pod Spawn
action->Pod Spawn.description:
Should a Small or larger creature die within a pod prison, the pod transforms into an adult moonflower with full Hit Points after [[/br 1d4 #Moonflower Transformation]]{1d4 hours} of growth.

The newly formed moonflower has its own consciousness, but some aspect of its trunk or blossoms resembles the creature that died within. The dead creature's equipment remains inside the new moonflower and can be retrieved if the moonflower is slain.

action->Spray Blossoms.name: Spray Blossoms
action->Spray Blossoms.description:
Effect The moonflower expels mindwarping petals in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[4d6[mental],4d6[poison]]{4d6 mental damage and 4d6 poison damage} (@Check[will|dc:26|basic]). On a failure, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute, and on a critical failure, they are also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round.

The moonflower can't Spray Blossoms again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Spray Blossoms]]{1d4 rounds}.

Large, @Damage[(2d10+10)[bludgeoning],2d6[acid]]{2d10 + 10 bludgeoning and 2d6 acid}, Rupture 21
